description.narrative:
ICSC har ansökt om finansiering från Sida om 8 178 559 SEK för att genomföra insatsen "Resilient Civil Society in Times of Scrunity" med verksamhet globalt och under perioden 1 januari - 31 december 2021.
Insatsens mål är att stärka ansvarighet, främja sektorsamarbete, öka inkludering av intressenter och främja resiliens och innovation inom det civila samhället. För perioden 1 januari - 31 december 2021 föreslår ICSC följande programspår:
1) Global Standard for CSO Accountability 2) ICSOs Bridging Society Divide 3) Making Voices Heard and Count 4) Cross-cutting - Innovative and Digital Capacity.
Programmet har en total budget på 8 178 559 SEK och ICSC ansöker om hela beloppet från Sida. Uppskattningsvis kommer omkring 4 637 404 SEK, cirka 57 % av den totala budgeten, att vidareförmedlas till partners.

ICSC has applied to Sida for funding of 8 178 559 SEK to carry out the project "Resilient Civil Society in Times of Scrunity" with operations globally and during the period of January 1st - December 31st 2021.
The aim of the project is to is to strengthen accountability, enhance sector collaboration, increase inclusion of all stakeholders and foster resilience and innovation in CSO work in times of global crisis. For the period of January 1st - December 31st 2021, ICSC suggest the following programme streams:
1) Global Standard for CSO Accountability 2) ICSOs Bridging Society Divide 3) Making Voices Heard and Count 4) Cross-cutting - Innovative and Digital Capacity.
The contribution has a total budget of 8 178 559 SEK and ICSC is applying for the whole amount from Sida. Approximately 4 637 404 SEK, 57 % of the total budget, will be forwarded from ICSC to partners.

Insatsens övergripande mål är följande: "The objective of the 2021 extension phase is to strengthen accountability, enhance sector collaboration, increase inclusion of all stakeholders and foster resilience and innovation in CSO work in times of global crisis". För att åstadkomma detta har ICSC formulerat följande specifika mål per programspår: Stream 1) Global Standard for CSO Accountability - Promote the use and engagement with the Global Standard at the national, regional and global levels through the Partnership - Provide ad-hoc support for organisations to adapt and use the Global Standard to address challenges according to their needs and context - Increase the knowledge pool on the Global Standard, Dynamic Accountability and its practices - Engage and influence key decision-making actors in the development sector to enhance the profile of the Global Standard - Strengthen the sustainability of the Partnership by mobilizing additional resources Stream 2) ICSOs Bridging Society Divide - Strengthen solidarity among ICSOs and CSO partners by exchanging learnings and response strategies through SANE - Establish a strong eco-system of national and global CSO actors by advancing the SANE on the country level - Increase CSOs ability to operate in the digital civic space by creating a secure online space for exchange of know-how and capacity building - Increase ICSOs awareness on needs and challenges of more inclusive power models by expanding the Power Shift Community towards new actors and disseminating results more broadly Stream 3) Making Voices Heard and Count - Enhance capacities of national CSOs and local civil society for a meaningful engagement in an evidence-driven SDG monitoring, review and implementation - Strengthen existing participatory spaces and feedback mechanisms that give voice and agency to marginalised communities - Close knowledge gaps on drivers of marginalisation via community-driven data generation - Influence the revision and/or generation of meaningful policies and services to address the situation of marginalised groups - Foster an enabling political environment towards a more evidence-driven, inclusive and participatory SDG implementation, based on the increased recognition and use of community-driven data.

tag.narrative: 1.b - Create sound policy frameworks at the national, regional and international levels, based on pro-poor and gender-sensitive development strategies, to support accelerated investment in poverty eradication actions.

1.b - Upprätta sunda policyramverk på nationell, regional och internationell nivå på grundval av utvecklingsstrategier som stödjer de fattiga och tar hänsyn till jämställdhetsaspekter, för att stödja ökade investeringar i åtgärder för att avskaffa fattigdom.
10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
